docs.lead_paragraph: West Bromwich Albion are likely to hand the Premier League's oldest outfield player Gareth McAuley a new contract, manager Tony Pulis said ahead of Saturday's clash with Crystal Palace.

headline.main: McAuley Closing In on New West Brom Deal
headline.print_headline: McAuley Closing In on New West Brom Deal

docs.lead_paragraph: The once promising presidential bid of French conservative Francois Fillon, already seriously hobbled by pending corruption charges, was coming unraveled Friday with the resignation of his campaign director and his campaign spokesman, adding momentum to a stream of defections and panicking his party.

headline.main: French Candidate Going It Alone Amid Campaign Defections
headline.print_headline: French Candidate Going It Alone Amid Campaign Defections

docs.lead_paragraph: A 17-year-old Georgia boy has lost both his feet after being hit by a train in suburban Atlanta.

docs.lead_paragraph: Authorities in Florida are cleaning up after a tanker truck loaded with gasoline and diesel fuel flipped over at Port Everglades in Fort Lauderdale.

docs.lead_paragraph: The head of a Syrian dissident group at peace talks in Geneva said on Friday that the United Nations was likely to conclude eight days of negotiations later in the day and outline an agenda, format and date for the next round.

headline.main: U.N. Plan for Next Round of Syria Talks Likely on Friday: Makdissi

docs.lead_paragraph: Charities expressed outrage on Friday as the mayor of French port Calais, which has symbolised Europe's refugee crisis, signed a ban on gatherings that could stop aid groups distributing meals to migrants and refugees.

headline.main: Charities Slam Calais Ban That Could Halt Food Aid for Migrants

docs.lead_paragraph: Credit Agricole, France's third-biggest listed bank, could relocate about one hundred employees from its London hub to France out of 1,000 based there, in case of a "hard" Brexit from the European Union, its chief executive said.

headline.main: Credit Agricole Could Relocate About 10 Percent of London Staff to France in Case of Hard Brexit
headline.print_headline: Credit Agricole Could Relocate About 10 Percent of London Staff to France in Case of Hard Brexit

docs.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Theresa May has told her Conservative Party's Scottish conference that preserving the unity of the United Kingdom is a key objective of her government.

docs.lead_paragraph: Russia said on Friday it was ready to help unify Libya and wanted to foster dialogue between rival authorities in Tripoli and factions in the east of the country.
